text: Heads up - a config PR was merged in which gets rid of txnvalidator.js from the repo by renaming it to txnvalidator.js.example.  git will tell you if you are impacted when you attempt to fetch/rebase.  dev benefit is that txnvalidator.js is no longer tracked in git, so that will make the normal fetch/rebase cycle nicer.  So now if you want to make changes to txnvalidator.js, copy txnvalidator.js.example to txnvalidator.js and edit from there.
Other benefit <@U0YQQRNU8> pointed out to me was if you use the config file you only have to include the settings you are overriding.
